qas.question: "Charlie's Angels" featured which single from the band members?
How many weeks did their single "Independent Women Part I" stay on top?
For what network, did Beyonce land a major movie role in?
Their third album, Survivor, sold how many during its first week?
What French composer wrote the original opera ''Carmen'' in the 19th century?
What album caused a lawsuit to be filed in 2001?
Independent Women Part I was on which 2000 film's soundtrack?
Which film did Beyoncé star in 2001 with Mekhi Phifer?
What was the name of Destiny Child's third album?
Who filed a lawsuit over Survivor?
When did Destiny's Child announce their hiatus?

context: The remaining band members recorded "<a0_0>Independent Women Part I<a0_0/>", which appeared on the soundtrack to the 2000 film, <a6_0>Charlie's Angels.<a6_0/> It became their best-charting single, topping the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart for <a1_0>eleven<a1_0/> consecutive weeks. In early 2001, while Destiny's Child was completing their third album, Beyoncé landed a major role in the <a2_0>MTV<a2_0/> made-for-television film, <a7_0>Carmen: A Hip Hopera<a7_0/>, starring alongside American actor Mekhi Phifer. Set in Philadelphia, the film is a modern interpretation of the 19th century opera Carmen by French composer <a4_0>Georges Bizet<a4_0/>. When the third album <a5_0><a8_0>Survivor<a8_0/><a5_0/> was released in May 2001, <a9_0>Luckett and Roberson<a9_0/> filed a lawsuit claiming that the songs were aimed at them. The album debuted at number one on the U.S. Billboard 200, with first-week sales of <a3_0>663,000 copies<a3_0/> sold. The album spawned other number-one hits, "Bootylicious" and the title track, "Survivor", the latter of which earned the group a Grammy Award for Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals. After releasing their holiday album 8 Days of Christmas in <a10_0>October 2001<a10_0/>, the group announced a hiatus to further pursue solo careers.
